quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: It’s like they already decided I’m the problem before even looking at the evidence.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I know, and that’s why I’ve said to them the evidence has to be central, not assumptions.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: But when evidence disappears, assumptions win.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: That’s true, and I keep challenging them on that point.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: Feels like no matter what I give them, it’ll vanish or be ignored.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I understand, Ben. That’s why I’ll keep checking and re-checking what they log.

contradictions.issue: Victim states bias against him; evidence disappears vs. advocate insists she challenges but acknowledges risk
